data.title: Dive into anything
data.text:
Here are the upcoming rebranding soon-to-be former CW affiliates as of September 1st

Confirmed CW 19 Pittsburgh: Rebranding as WPKD and will becoming KDKA+ CW 44 Bay Area: Rebranding as KPYX and will becoming KPIX+ CW 57 Philly: Rebranding as Philly 57 (Going back to the early days of Philly 57) CW 50 Detroit: Rebranding as Detroit 50 CW 31 Sacramento: Rebranding as KMAX 31

No rebranding yet for Atlanta, Seattle, and Tampa unless two of the 3 stations could be switching to CBS.

Here are the new CW affiliates that has been confirmed: Philadelphia: WPHL Tampa: WTTA San Francisco: KRON Sacramento: KQCA Pittsburgh: WPNT

Major cities are still waiting for their new CW affiliates: Seattle: We could see a swap of KSTW and KIRO before September 1st. We could sent KIRO to the CW and KSTW to CBS and likely becoming CBS 11 and launch CBS News Seattle on the streaming service. Atlanta: We could see a swap of possible of WANF and WUPA before September 1st Because CBS owns WUPA, they could be switching to CBS instead of an independent station and WANF could end up with the CW unless WATL or WPCH could take over as a CW affiliate. Detroit: We are still waiting from a word from the sale of WADL to Mission and we haven't heard from them since May. If the sale reaches by September 1st, WADL could likely be a new CW affiliate. If the sale doesn't reach by September 1st, WMYD or a subchannel of WDIV could temporarily be carrying the CW until the sale of WADL is complete.
